page.title: 09CHOON DAIRY-FARM,ALLET,TRURO
page.content: Choon is a 116 acre farm on a south- facing slope, with a dairy herd of 50 Friesian & South Devon cows. Heifers are kept as dairy-followers for replacement, bull-calves are fattened for beef;there are a few hens. Corn is grown for animal feed, with grass cut for silage & hay. The buildings are mostly old cob, with some modern ones for storage of cattle-cake etc. The farmer, his wife & son run the farm. Now, in late autumn, there is time to repair buildings, equipment, gates, & Cornish-hedges. Today the farmer has renewed a bin in the milking-parlour; this evening (Friday) he is preparing a sermon for Sunday at Allet Chapel where he is a local preacher. The main problem on the farm at the moment, after this week's rain, is mud in the yard & where fields slope to a stream.
